headlines.description: Tottenham Hotspur turned up the pressure on Arsenal as they moved into the top four of the Premier League thanks to a 1-0 win against Burnley.
headlines.shortLinkText: Tottenham win to snatch top four initiative

headlines.description: — Substitute Jeffrey Schlupp scored an 81st-minute equalizer as Crystal Palace secured a 1-1 draw at Aston Villa in a match between two midtable teams in the Premier League on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Midtable rivals Villa and Palace draw 1-1 in Premier League

events.name: Brighton & Hove Albion at Leeds United

headlines.description: A stoppage-time goal from Pascal Struijk snatched Leeds United a crucial 1-1 draw against Brighton to lift them out of the relegation zone.
headlines.shortLinkText: Struijk snatches vital last-gasp draw for Leeds

headlines.description: — Jamie Vardy and Harvey Barnes each scored twice as Roy Hodgson’s final home match in charge of already-relegated Watford ended in an embarrassing 5-1 Premier League loss to Leicester on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Leicester routs Watford 5-1 in Hodgson's last home game

events.name: Manchester City at West Ham United

headlines.description: Riyad Mahrez missed a late penalty as Manchester City slipped up in the Premier League title race after drawing 2-2 at West Ham United on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Man City slip up in title race with West Ham draw

headlines.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers' hopes of playing in Europe next season ended following a 1-1 draw with relegated Norwich City
headlines.shortLinkText: Wolves draw with Norwich as European hopes end

headlines.description: Yoane Wissa created one goal and scored another as Brentford compounded Everton's Premier League relegation woes with a thrilling 3-2 victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Nine-man Everton lose 5-goal thriller to Brentford
